summary: Group One, a trading firm specializing in options trading, took a position that includes the option to buy 1.26 million shares of MicroStrategy.
title: Options trading firm Group One takes position in MicroStrategy
content: Options trading firm Group One took a "beneficial ownership" position in MicroStrategy that includes the option to buy 1.26 million shares of Class A common stock, according to a document filed with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission.
MicroStrategy is one of the largest holders of bitcoin, with a total of about 132,500 BTC as of Dec. 28.

<iframe frameborder="0" height="420" src="https://www.theblock.co/data/crypto-markets/public-companies/microstrategy-bitcoin-holdings/embed" title="MicroStrategy Bitcoin Holdings" width="100%" data-v-f87c67ca=""></iframe>

Based in Chicago, Group One has been in business since 1989 and mostly operates in the options trading market, it says on its website. It maintains a physical presence on the Chicago Board Options Exchange, New York Stock Exchange Amex and Arca and Nasdaq PHLX.
The firm didn't immediately respond to a request for comment.
(Corrects earlier story that referred to the purchase as an equity stake.)
